poem:
Title: "The Caucus Wake"

In the marrowed silence of political ritual,
Iowa wakens from its hallowed sleep. 
In the caucus' labyrinth, voices knit a shroud, 
each the hymn of a nominee, steeped in devotion.
Lost in the whispering cornfields, an arcane dance,
A democracy's pulse echoing the heartbeat of thicket and thorn.
Unseen, yet deeply felt, shaping a nation's cresting morn.
